newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche Postbank to cross shares with BHW.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche Postbank to cross shares with BHW.

text.p: Deutsche Postbank AG said on Tuesday it had reached a cooperation agreement with BHW of Hameln, with each taking a stake of at least 10 percent in the other.
Deutsche Postbank said it expects its 1996 group profit to exceed the 226 million marks ($148.4 million) it earned last year. ($ = 1.522 German Marks)
BHW is a building society for civil servants. Its full name is BHW Bausparkasse Beamtenheimstaettenwerk Gemeinnuetzige Bausparkasse fuer den oeffentlichen Dienst GmbH.
Postbank is due to be privatised in the near future, but has been tangled in a battle with the postal service Deutsche Post AG over the ownership structure.
